com.hazelcast.internal.diagnostics

Class SystemLogPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.internal.diagnostics.DiagnosticsPlugin
      • com.hazelcast.internal.diagnostics.SystemLogPlugin

  • public class SystemLogPlugin
extends DiagnosticsPlugin
    The SystemLogPlugin is responsible for:
    1. Showing lifecycle changes like shutting down, merging etc.
    2. Show connection creation and connection closing. Also the causes of closes are included.
    3. Showing membership changes.
    4. Optionally showing partition migration
    This plugin is very useful to get an idea what is happening inside a cluster; especially when there are connection related problems. This cluster has a low overhead and is meant to run in production.

      • ENABLED

        public static final HazelcastProperty ENABLED

      • LOG_PARTITIONS

        public static final HazelcastProperty LOG_PARTITIONS
        If logging partition migration is enabled. Because there can be so many partitions, logging the partition migration can be very noisy.

    • Method Detail

      • getPeriodMillis

        public long getPeriodMillis()
        Description copied from class: DiagnosticsPlugin
        Returns the period of executing the monitor in millis. If a monitor is disabled, 0 is returned. If a monitor should run only once, a negative value is returned. This is useful for 'static' monitors like the SystemPropertiesPlugin that run at the beginning of a log file but their contents will not change.
        Specified by:
        getPeriodMillis in class DiagnosticsPlugin
        Returns:
        the period in millis.
